prs.title: all: Implement optional PectraBlobSchedule fork/feature
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

This implements the optional _backwards_-hardfork `PectraBlobSchedule`. If enabled, the L1BlockInfo will have its blob base fee calculated using the Cancun blob parameters until the specified `PectraBlobScheduleTime`. It will then only from that timestamp onwards use the correct L1 blob schedule. This is intended to be used when the L1 already has Pectra activated but the L1Bloc

commits.message: op-node/rollup: Implement optional L1 Pectra fix
make simple test fail with excess blob gas
address proto's feedback, add test case

prs.title: op-deployer: add command to verify contracts
prs.truncated_body:
## Overview
Closes https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/13544

Provides a user-friendly command to verify L1 contracts on etherscan. The following information is used for verification:
* contract addresses: pulled from the input .json file
* contract artifact info (source code, compile settings): pulled from artifacts specified by `artifacts-locator` flag
* constructor args:

commits.message: use l2-chain-id flag instead of l2-chain-index
update to use new artifacts.Download function definition
read constructor args from deployment tx initcode
return error if contract creation query fails
use more informative contract-name flag description
calc num constructorArgSlots by parsing abi
add json tags (matching contract bundle) to deploy script outputs
bootstrap default to writing to bootstrap_<command>.json file
pass contracts-locator flag to verify command
minimize flags required for bootstrap, verify
make artifact lookup compatible with fragmented opcm
use require instead of assert in tests

prs.title: feat: introduce eth lockbox
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

Introducing the `ETHLockbox` contract to improve the Superchain’s interoperable ETH withdrawal user experience, preventing withdrawal failures caused by insufficient ETH in the `OptimismPortal`.

Design doc: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/pull/206
Spec: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/pull/465

prs.title: add new Plume mainnet
prs.truncated_body: Users on the existing Plume private mainnet with chain ID 98865 will be migrated over to the new Plume private mainnet over the next several weeks, before we mark the existing Plume private mainnet as deprecated.
